data.question: What happens to the 3D spin-crossover networks in [Fe(pdm)(H2O){Ag(CN)2}2]·H20 upon losing coordinated water molecules?
data.answer: They transform into a single 3D network.

data.question: Is the transformation of the 3D spin-crossover networks reversible?
data.answer: Yes

data.question: What is the ultimate goal of constructing sensory and memory devices using coordination polymers?
data.answer: The construction of sensory and memory devices is the ultimate goal.

data.question: What causes the distinctive changes in magnetism, color, and structure of iron(ii) spin crossover (SCO) building blocks?
data.answer: The switching between the high- (HS) and low-spin (LS) states.

data.question: What type of transition do compounds 1 Ag and 1 Au undergo?
data.answer: Thermally induced first-order, spin-crossover transitions.

data.question: Does the crystalline-state ligand substitution involving coordination/uncoordination of gaseous water and pmd affect the crystallinity of the coordination polymers?
data.answer: No

data.question: What is the effect of the crystalline-state ligand substitution on the SCO behavior of the coordination polymers?
data.answer: It alters their SCO behavior significantly.

data.question: What happens to the nanoporous framework as a result of the crystalline-state ligand substitution?
data.answer: It induces expansion/contraction of the nanoporous framework.

data.question: Is the process of topochemical conversion of a hydrogen-bonded into a covalent bonded supramolecular network reversible in the case of [{Zn(sala)-(H2O)2}2]·2 H2O?
data.answer: No

data.question: What triggers the color change in compounds 1 Ag, 1 Au, and 2 Ag?
data.answer: The spin-crossover (SCO) transition.

data.question: What is the role of the pmd ligand in the structure of compound 2?
data.answer: The pmd ligand bridges directly the Fe(1) and Fe(2) atoms defining a system of infinite chains.

data.question: What is the result of exposing 1 Au and 1 Ag to an atmosphere of H2O?
data.answer: Selective absorption of this vapor induces the inverse reaction at the Fe(2) sites, regenerating the three independent 3D networks.

data.question: Does the dehydration process of 1 Ag and 1 Au to form 2 Ag and 2 Au involve the loss of symmetry from monoclinic to triclinic in 2 Ag?
data.answer: Yes

data.question: What is the significance of the cooperative combination of different molecular events in the same lattice?
data.answer: It is of fundamental significance for the generation of new switchable, multi-property materials.

data.question: What is the chemical formula of the compound synthesized by slow diffusion under an argon atmosphere?
data.answer: 1 Ag

data.question: Are the dehydrated samples 2 Ag and 2 Au prepared from 1 Ag and 1 Au in the SQUID sample holder?
data.answer: Yes

data.question: What is the behavior of the cMT value for 2 Ag at room temperature?
data.answer: It remains constant down to 125 K, indicating that the iron(ii) ion is in the HS state.

data.question: Does compound 2 Au undergo a spin transition in the whole temperature range?
data.answer: No

data.question: What is the effect of the bridging mode of the pmd ligand on the ligand-field strength at the Fe(1) site?
data.answer: It indicates a decrease of the ligand-field strength at the Fe(1) site.

data.question: What is the role of the [M(CN)2] groups in the structure of compound 1?
data.answer: The [M(CN)2] groups link the Fe(1) and Fe(2) atoms generating groups which connect to form rectangular motifs.
